snippet: Two days after his re-election, President Obama had made no public remarks outside his victory speech, and will have few forays into the public eye in the coming week.
abstract: White House Memo notes that after protracted and contentious campaign, Pres Obama has gone quiet in two days since his re-election, making no public remarks outside his victory speech; holds that the president is poised to address nation about the economy.
lead_paragraph: Two days after his re-election, President Obama had made no public remarks outside his victory speech, and will have few forays into the public eye in the coming week.

headline.seo: Obama’s Quiet Return to the White House
headline.main: Marathon Over, a Muted Return to Washington
headline.print_headline: Marathon Over, A Muted Return To Washington
